Body: My Samsung Galaxy S5 has been stolen and with the unfortunate power button menu that requires no passwords to access it's been put into airplane mode. Is there a way to remotely wipe it? If not is there a way to access and change the lockscreen or password settings from my google account?I use this phone for work and it contains alot of confidential information on it such as texts, files, emails, etc. is there any way to remotely wipe it or hack into it to erase confidential information?
Title: Samsung S5 android phone stolen and put on airplane mode. Is there a way to remotely wipe it?

history.Text: My Samsung Galaxy S5 has been stolen and with the unfortunate power button menu that requires no passwords to access it's been put into airplane mode. Is there a way to remotely wipe it?
